review.title: We felt lucky to leave with our lives the next day
review.reviewText: No parking, rooms are ANCIENT and disgusting. First room we were given was dirty and the beds were unmade. Second room the tile in bathroom was all broken, EVERY corner had dirt balls in them, the TV didn't work properly. Not to mention that entering the hotel was like going to a haunted house. Plus it was WY overpriced.
review.locationRemarks: Tons to do nearby

review.reviewText: Walking distance to union square where you can find all the major stores. Bus stops and railcars are close by. Overall not bad, cheap rooms, and friendly staff. Parking is a bit expensive but so is everywhere else, so plan a budget just for parking.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Me and my daughter stayed for four (4) nights and five (5) days.  At first, we are planning just to stay for one (1) night then look for another hotel, but changed our mind coz we find Super 8 as best location and all the Staff from front desk to housekeeping very friendly and accommodating. Over all condition of the hotel and the free breakfast, no problem, we are satisfied. Thanks to all the Staff of Super 8 and also to Expedia. We had a great time staying to Super 8.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk personnel are excellent Staff.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location close to everything. Only beggars the problem. One crazy lady plan to hit me but I was blessed to saw her and avoid her.

review.title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed
review.reviewText:
Very bad experience 1 was no hot water 
Other thing we were leaving to go to airport in the morning 6 am there was nobody at the reception to unlock the door for us to go out for 15minutes 
We could see our taxi waiting outside we had to request our taxi driver to wait.
Other person was waiting to come in.he kept ringing the bell no answer we kept phoning but no on answer.

review.title: Not so great area
review.reviewText: This hotel is in need of renovation/updating.  The area is rough, lots of homeless and panhandlers. It is close to Union Square.  The rooms are small and walls seem pretty thin, since we could hear our neighbors conversations.  The elevator is crazy-scary.  Although we were on the sixth floor, we opted to take the stairs.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk personnel were polite, kind and very accommodating.

review.title: Nice hotel with very good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is next to various restaurants and stores. Is easy to move through the city, since it's close to bus stops and the Bart. Hotel staff is very nice and make sure your stay is good too.

review.title: Close to the center of downtown.
review.reviewText: It's OK.  No real negatives.  It's an older building and the rooms (at least ours) are small, but not bad.  The continental breakfast includes hot/cold cereal, toast, yoghurt, juices, coffee, tea, sweet buns, bananas . . .

review.title: Nice downtown hotel with great staff!
review.reviewText:
I was very concerned about staying at a somewhat comfortable hotel in downtown SF, because I have read so many bad reviews about other hotels in the area, that I was kind of pessimistic. But this hotel really helped my trip into becoming a memorable one, great price for what I was getting, considering that other hotels in the area I would have to be sharing a bathroom. This one I had my privacy, my own bathroom, cable TV, and a nice queen size bed. They cleaned my room every single day I spent in SF, bed sheets were clean, and everything smelled nice! No complaints at all about my room. The location is great! I felt safe to walk everywhere, and it's right downtown, that are some Starbucks 1 block away from it, and it's located at one of the main streets in SF. 
Also, the staff was excellent! I loved my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, cleanness, amenities, and location
review.locationRemarks: The location is great, right next bus stops, downtown, many restaurants, stores, very walkable.

review.title: Great value, good location.
review.reviewText: Polite, helpful staff, decent room with good bed. Generally good facilities though bathroom looking slightly tired. Very good location for buses/tram and walking. Surprisingly not too noisy given central location. Breakfast fine, nothing outstanding, but plenty available.

review.title: Great location and staff!
review.reviewText: Stayed at some higher priced hotels in the area before and first time staying at the Super 8. I have to say that it was a pleasant stay since location is central to the areas I intended on visiting during my stay. Uber was ~$8-$10 for everywhere I wanted to go (pier 39, chinatown, etc...). Staff was friendly and helpful since  the time I walked through the lobby doors. I understand that the building is older and stuff, I would say it was a good bang for the buck and would stay again.

review.title: Good location and value
review.reviewText: Staff was pleasant, room clean although small -however my accessible bathroom was huge.  Elevator needs repair.  Free breakfast was reasonable, although the dining area was too small. Great location!  2 blocks to Union Square, transportation and variety of restaurants nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!  2 blocks to Union Square & Powell St cable car. Mass transportation and many restaurants nearby.  New Delhi Restaurant was very good

review.title: Good value, great location
review.reviewText: Good breakfast, great location near Union Sq. Hotel is old but clean and staff is friendly anmd helpful. Nothing fancy but much less expensive than big name hotels a block ot two away. Would stay again!
Old . Terrible smell around hotel . Breakfast very simple .

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location, close to Union square and all public transport (trolley, bus, BART). Clean hotel and nice enough breakfast.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Union Square. Alot of great places near by. Room was kind of small but it was clean and unlike alot of other San Francisco hotels you get your own restroom

review.title: Decent Super 8
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Great location. Breakfast was small and not nearly as good as most other Super 8s. Overall a good value for the money.
Confusing check in and  check out. Room ok but location, entrance and hallways were not clean and didn't feel safe for a family. Too pricey.

review.title: Cute hotel close to union square
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel is awesome ! You walk to union square in a few minutes and still it's pretty quiet out at night . Hotel staff is friendly and helpful and the room was clean and cute . I'm saying "cute" because it was rather small but it was more than enough for our stay . The only thing was we extended our stay for a night and the cleaning personal kept on knocking and yelling on the door while we were still sleeping and we had to talk to them and explain for a long Time because their English wasn't the greatest ! Apart from
That miscommunication between hotel and employees it was a very good stay !

review.title: be warned
review.reviewText: Checked in and got on elevator which is expired, safety doc on the wall expired months earlier.  Got to room and discovered it was very small.  no room for luggage, and was very dirty.   Blankets on the bed had something dirty on them.  They charged my credit card a buck in the middle of the night.  I guess that was for sleeping.   checkout was 11am and they called room to make sure we were out .  RUDE ...
review.locationRemarks: lots to do

review.title: Great value for Union Square
review.reviewText: My wife and I just stayed here for four days while we were in San Francisco on vacation and I can highly recommend them. We had checked hotel prices for the Union Square area prior to booking and were somewhat shocked at what rooms cost for this area. We also noticed that something like your own bathroom is not necessarily a fact. We read some reviews of other hotels in the area that talked of small rooms and poor service at only $400 and up a night. Then we found Super 8. Yes, the room was small. But it was clean, an older hotel, but clean. It had it's own bathroom. It included a basic breakfast. Not a fancy breakfast but very probably what most people would have on a daily basis at home. Worked for me. Check in was good, bed was comfortable, in the area that we wanted to stay in and the price was more than reasonable. I'd stay here again.
Good stay! You get what you pay for. It was clean, good location as far as being centrally located for waking. Not the nicest part of town but I never felt unsafe. Staff was really friendly.

review.title: nice hotel near to union square.
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel , which has good structure, a great location and breakfast very good
review.positiveRemarks: nice room , clean and with a fridge . Separate room and bathroom with tub. the hotel is close to union square and good restaurants nearby
review.locationRemarks: pubs, stores, restaurantes near.

review.title: My stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was located within walking distance to public transportation to the pier and the Warfield theater where I attended a concert.  My room was clean, the bed was comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Catch a trolley to the pier, ride on a site sighting bus tour, see a live performance at the Warfield.

review.title: Nice stay.
review.reviewText:
We visit the city for a short stay attending two games of the Giants.
Good location and appropiate rate for such kind of facilities.
Could return on any future opportunity we have.

managementResponses.response:
thank you for your review.we really appreciate you for taking your valuable time to write a review.thank you for liking our hotel.we try to provide the best service and glad that you liked it.we look forward to see you in your next visit.thank you again.
manoj pathak,front desk

review.title: Great location with all you need
review.reviewText: Very convenient hotel for a conference, clean and comfortable in a great location with good wifi.

managementResponses.response: thank you for your review.we are glad that you liked our staffs .we try to do our best to give good service to our guest and we also try to give high priority to the cleanliness of the room .we are sorry that we didnt like our lobby area and breakfast menu.we will be upgrading our lobby area to make it more beteer and more comfortable to our guest.also we will try to improve our breakfast menu. we are sorry about the smells .we are really strict on the smoking in the hotel property and definately will give high priority on this matter.thank you for staying in our hotel and looking forward in your next visit

review.title: Great stay, comfy beds and pillows.
review.reviewText: Occasional noise towards the roadside. Hotel lobby doesnot have any extra area to relax. Its very cramped, after 6 in the evening a strong smell of weed gets overpowering. It continues all along the room corridors.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby area needs significant improvement. Breakfast menu can be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location.

managementResponses.response: thank you for your review. we are happy that you liked our hotel .we try to provide good front desk service and glad that you liked it.looking forward to seeing you in your next visit.

review.title: Good stayed
review.reviewText: Simple but good hotel, near to everywhere, kind staff and confortable bedroom

review.title: Pictures are deceiving! YIKES!
review.reviewText: There was no parking for the hotel unless you wanted to pay $35 for valet and there was a nightclub or something on the other side of the wall.  There are people smoking crack pipes on the front stoop of the hotel.  The room was barely big enough to fit your suitcase in and still have room to walk around the bed.  The continental breakfast was a joke and there was a gap under the door big enough to see under the door.  I was 50/50 expecting to wake up with bed bugs.  There was dried loogies on the wall by the trash can and the elevator smelled strongly of urine.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close enough to Fishermans Warf

managementResponses.response: We are happy that you had a good stay at Super 8 Union square. We will be working on upgrading our rooms sometime soon. Thank you very much for the suggestion and review.

review.title: Location, location, location near Union Sq, SF
review.reviewText:
I have stayed most of the hotels in the neighborhood.
This is the low key, affordable hotel in the area. Conveniently located. As other reviews said it is at the boarder of Tenderloin area - it is San Francisco so deal with it.
Not like the other hotels across the street, this hotel is not updated as boutique hotel.
It is comfortable and not as tiny as some of the hotels Union Square East.
Old building with budget conscious operation - good enough for my business stay for a few nights.
People at front desk are friendly and professional enough.
Room is clean but I would expect upgrade/replacement of furniture and carpet sometime soon.
All equipment works as it should. Don't expect high-end boutique hotel service, then you will be okay.
review.locationRemarks: It is located in the middle of all activities in SF.

managementResponses.response: Thank you very much for staying at Super 8 Union Square. We are glad that we were able to assist you during your stay. Hope to see you again.

review.reviewText:
Simple hotel.but close to everything! 
Staff is mostly friendly and Mr. Patel, the general manager, is very helpful!
Basic hotel. Clean and convenient location. Staff was very nice. Small room but that is normal for hotels in Union Square area.

review.title: Great hotel for a night
review.reviewText: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for one night in our two day trip to San Francisco. We arrived around 4pm and the man at the front desk let us know their computer system was down so they were doing everything by paper. Once he found the reservation, he called and asked the cleaning woman if there was a clean room available. There wasn't, so he had us sit and wait until it was clean. It didn't take too long and the room was clean when we got inside. The room is pretty small but I didn't expect anything else from the old building. We had no problems with the hotel during our stay there. The breakfast was pretty limited to two types of cereal, breakfast claws, toast, and waffles. But it was enough to fill us up. There is a corner store about two buildings down and that was really convenient for water. Even though it's near Tenderloin, we didn't feel unsafe but I wouldn't recommend going out too late either. Overall, the staff was very nice, the room was clean, and it was perfect for one night in the city.
There's a night club nearby so ask for a room on a higher floor

managementResponses.response:
Dear Hellini,

Thank you for your perfect 5-star rating. Your valuable feedback truly means a lot to us. You are absolutely right about our location. Indeed, the proximity of our location is really convenient to everything. Also, I feel glad that our staffs were able to be of your assistance. 

Thank you again for staying at Super 8. We look forward to welcoming you again in coming days.

Have a great weekend!

Sam

review.title: Close to everything in SF
review.reviewText: We had a very enjoyable stay. Staff were helpful and friendly. Accomodation was clean and well located.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Good value for money. Windows opened for fresh air.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Maureen,

Thank you for sharing your comments regarding your recent experience with us.

We feel absolute delighted to know that you had overall a wonderful stay with us and you were able to make the most out of our handy location and you liked our breakfast.

We hope to see you soon again.

Regards,
Sam

review.title: Cute small hotel ...close to everything !!,
review.reviewText:
We went to watch the Chineese New Year Parade. And it was very close to all activities at
Union Square.. Very comfortable room .....small but comfortable !!
review.positiveRemarks:
It's very quaint !! And the manager was so nice....
Breakfast was absolutely wonderful !
Cereal, waffles yogurt, fruit juice and coffee
review.locationRemarks: Perfect Union Square location......plenty of restaurants etc

review.reviewText: The a advertisement for this place fails to mention that they have 0 parking and parking is limited and expensive. I had to pay $40 extra for valet parking after spending nearly an hour driving around trying to find parking. Was not happy with this place. Definitely not worth an extra $40 unexpected charge.

review.title: just what you look for in san francisco,
review.reviewText: the price was right, the servise was great, and the location was perfect
review.negativeRemarks: because the building is so old, you couldent expect it to increase size of room or the age of the structure
review.locationRemarks: greagt location right off union square

review.reviewText: Nice and inexpensive alternative to the much overpriced Hilton-Superbowl weekend no less-  pleasant stay!

review.title: Terrible hotel in a worse neighborhood
review.reviewText: First of all it says "Super 8 Union Sq" its not in union sq its in tenderloin which is the worst neighborhood in SF. Literally a warning from the sfpd not to walk around at night. People begging for money & going thru the garbage right outside the front door of hotel & the staff act like its a normal ok thing. I get it the room was cheap but dont lie in the description to decieve people that they are getting a deal to book the hotel.  Switched bed rooms 3 time cause heater was broken in 1 room them the fuses kept blowing in the 2nd room. The 3rd room tv was broken but by this point I'm happy i was warm & I was in my room only to sleep. Elevator was a death trap that was out of service the last 2 days i stayed there. All in all its a cheap room for a reason, spend the extra money & get a better room to the east part of SF.

review.title: Hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel is alright if planning to stay in downtown area. Lots of transportation options nearby to visit anywhere in the city. Our room in particular was quite cramped, very little space for our luggage and dark due to window facing only a few feet from a brick wall. We were a couple, stayed here two nights and moved to another hotel afterwards. Very comfy bed though if traveling alone and only planning a night or two.

Great little hotel the street is not too dangerous as there are more sketchy streets in this area like Eddy, etc. the staff is very helpful and overall if you are looking for a cheap and safe place to stay in downtown SF this is it! I will probably stay here again if I go to SF.

review.title: Nice Hotel when one has to go to the VA Hospital.
review.reviewText: Overall it was a good experience the only complaint would be that it was a little noisy.  I think they should oil their elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Many nice places to eat and drink.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly. This hotel is right in the middle of almost everything. The only thing I didn't like was that u could hear everything the walls were really thin

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: had a little problem with my card they cancelled my reservation. lucky for me rooms still avail .. now iam waiting if i would get charge from expedia & the front desk

review.title: Good hotel in prime location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the high end neighborhood of union square.  It offers everything one needs at a fraction of the price the hotels in the vicinity command.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is surrounded by all the high end shopping destinations and in the vicinmity of all kinds of restaurants.

review.reviewText: Hotel has a good location and it is very clean. Staff friendly
Good location close to union square and the shopping district. Easy to walk to China town and cable car.
review.locationRemarks: Close to tourist activities and shops

review.title: Nice location for business trip
review.reviewText:
Close to the financial center, lots of public transport available.
Hotel is old and pretty basic, though rooms are quite well for a few days.

review.title: Good location basic hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, basic but clean hotel. Comfortable beds with breakfast included. We had a bedroom and lounge room which was a pleasant surprise.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast included was good, cereal, juice, toast, waffles and tea and coffee more than enough to start day. Short walk to Powell St and Union Sq.
review.negativeRemarks: It's an old hotel but clean
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Union Sq to catch Hop on hop off bus. Easy walk from airport train and F bus to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Worst hotel I have been at
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nothing like it was advertised.  We had two rooms booked.  First room smelt like stale urine  2nd room had very strong smell of bleach.  We actual did not end up staying at the hotel and moved to another one.    
What an absolute disgrace.   A 3.2 rating is totally inappropriate for this hotel.     For backpackers it might be suitable but certainly not for a family     Please review your rating system

review.title: Very good value in an often expensive area
review.reviewText: We had a room on the sixth floor. Small bedroom huge bathroom which was the only place to leave our bags. Comfortable bed, big TV, clean room. Good view of satellite dishes and opposite walls. No complaints as it is near Union Square, buses, trolleys, Market St, Walgreens. Westfield, Apple, Bart. Suited our budget as part of 35 days around Canada and USA. Adequate free breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Location location location. Clean, good bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Could do with bug screens on all the windows, and sticks to prop the windows up in the heat wave, although the aircon worked well.
review.locationRemarks: Market St, Apple Store, Walgreens, Westfield, Bart, Buses, choice of food places. A few harmless homeless hanging around.

review.title: Best Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: I think in this price range it's the best you can find. Everything else in that price range looked gross and got low ratings. It would be best for a 1-2 overnight stay. The neighborhood isn't scary, just your normal San Fran wanderers, definitely NOT upscale though. But in great walking distance of all the Union Square shopping. The room was REALLY small, but clean and comfortable with nice bedding.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything, nice bedding, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast had very little selection so we walked out with nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to Union Square and lots of things in walking or short cab ride.

review.reviewText: The room was clean and staff was very polite. Nothing fancy but good for the price.

review.title: No frills
review.reviewText:
Everything works.  It's a good cheap hotel and it's not in a bad part of the city.  It's older but the staff was excellent (for me at least)

WiFi works but don't expect it to be lightning fast or accessible by all devices.

review.title: Tired & well worn city centre hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel is located close to Union Square SF but even closer (next door) to a run down and not too pleasant Hostel. The Hotel itself although clean is rather old and drab. We had booked 3 nights and for 2 of the days there was no hot water.
review.negativeRemarks: Entire building in need of renovation, however that would not change the less than desirable physical location of the property.
review.locationRemarks: Direct and immediate access to all that is the city centre of San Francisco.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Location is good. Elevator is old. Price is a little high.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us. We hope to see you in the future soon

review.title: Nice hotel close to downtown/city center
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the nice location. Front desk staff was friendly. Breakfast was good. Hotel is located right in the middle of San Francisco action. I took transit from Airport to downtown. Once I disembarked, I could easily walk to the hotel within 5 minutes. Everything else is close by as well. This includes cable cars, union square, nice eateries and cafes, night clubs, 5 minutes cab ride or 15 minute cable car ride to popular locations such as lombard street, ghiradelli square, San Francisco Piers (to take cruises - including Alcatraz cruise). Good stay overall.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was little cold in the morning. Bathroom, especially, was really cold. I needed socks to walk into bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, right in the middle of action. Cable car, nice pubs, transit to airport - everything is super-close.

review.title:
Perfect location
Nice and clean
review.reviewText:
Nice small htl 
Perfect spot
Breakfast a little dissapointing
I recommend

review.title: Decent hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: If you want a cheap and decent hotel on Union Square, this is it. However, the rooms are small so plan accordingly, double bed is not a queen sized bed. 1 double bed fits us - 2 medium built asian male and female. Also, expect only basic facilities - room, free breakfast, fridge and a safe. The room and toilet is very clean.

review.title: A bit noisy and a bit cramped for the price
review.reviewText: Staff from reception to maintenance were pleasant and often helpful.  Yet for the price I found the room to be tiny and noisy as one could hear conversations, ice machines, etc. at all times of the day and night making it difficult to sleep unless one turned on the air conditioner/heater.

review.title: Lots of character!
review.reviewText: The room was clean. The building was older, but with lots of character. Had all the usual amenities (toiletries, etc). It was very nice. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  Not in the greatest neighborhood.  Continental breakfast was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: The price of the room was very affordable.  The location was also great.
review.negativeRemarks: The availability of valet parking without the lengthy wait to get vehicle.

managementResponses.response: thank you for your feedback. we look forward to seeing you in the future.

review.title: Great place downtown for cheap
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a conference at Moscone Center. About a 15 minute walk to the center. Great location for the price. It's on the edge of a neighborhood that is a bit sketchy late at night, but nothing to be too worried about if you're careful. Super friendly staff. Will definitely stay again for future conferences.

managementResponses.response: Glad you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you in the future

review.title: Overall very positive experience.
review.reviewText:
are not the best neighborhood. it is what it is. 
clean place. very secure & felt safe. 
room was cleaner than I expected. 
breakfast was not spectacular but was fuel for the start of the day.  
saw families, retirees, all sorts of people staying there. 
would go back.

review.title: It's a clean room- all we needed!
review.reviewText: We knew it was going to be basic, as we got a very good deal on the room for 4 nights. It was cheap but cheerful- the room was clean, the bathroom was clean, in a good enough location. It was great for uk. That being said it could definitely do with being modernized a little bit.
Old building. Tiny rooms. Comfortable bed. Nice front desk staff. Good location. Too expensive for what it is. If cheaper, would recommend.

review.title: Just like Paris
review.reviewText: This is an old building with tiny rooms. Reminds me small Paris hotels. Cozy, clean, and price is right.

review.title: Walking distance to shops in Union Square
review.reviewText: Room was small, however I was 1 person so not really a issue, room was clean and tidy.  Breakfast extremely basic but still ok.  Was talking distance to all the shops, restaurants in Union Square, felt safe walking around.  Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Pros
-Great location
-Clean
-Very good house keeping

Cons
-Staff was not the most personable (this was Ok for me)
-This is a busy street, keep windows shut for a good night's sleep
-Continental breakfast was short of food when we arrived
-Sink faucet sprayed water everywhere

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: The hotel is slightly dated, but I would say is extremely good value for money. My room was clean enough and comfortable enough with a decent bathroom. The location is very good for downtown San Francisco. Relative to other hotels in the surrounding area it offers exceptional value for money.

review.title: Good Hotel with good price
review.reviewText: Good location, cleaniness and excellent breakfast for a reasonable price.

review.title: nice hotel located close to union square.
review.reviewText: great place to crash one night - close to everything in San Francisco city - conditions of room were really good.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, Powell BART, cable car, Union Square shopping

review.title: Nice hotel, but not a good area at night.
review.reviewText: Hotel was great overall. The area is nice during the day time. Really scary at night.

managementResponses.response: Thanks i hope to see you again if you have another conference in the area

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: stayed thete for 3 days there  for a conference held in 55 parc wyenham. so the 5 minutes walk from it was awesome. the breakfast was ok. if i want to pick a bone that the wifi could faster. in general,  positive experience.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for your feedback the area is improving. We look forward to seeing you soon

review.title: Our 3 nights in Jan '15
review.reviewText: I'll keep this short and sweet - the location of the hotel was great, so close to all public transport and a wide variety of restaurants and diners. The room itself was good, found it a bit strange that the bathroom was almost, if not, as big as the bedroom. The complimentary breakfast wasn't anything flash, just enough to get you through to your next meal (toast, hot drinks, juices, yoghurt, bananas and waffles). I was worried after reading reviews before arriving about the comments of the homeless people hanging out the front. There was one out the front only on one morning. Unfortunately San Fran does seems to have a lot of homeless and beggers on every corner. Aside from this, the price of this hotel for the 3 nights we were there was great. Will definitely consider Super 8 again if I ever return!

review.title: Comfortable with great location
review.reviewText: Great location and very helpful staff. Hotel is a little old but comfortable. Very pleased with our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location right in the heart of the city.

review.title: Charming and Convenient!
review.reviewText: The place has character because it old. It is charming and convenient to Union Square. The price is excellent for the location. Beds are extremely comfortable. Room was exceptionally clean. Can't wait to go back the next time I am in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Close to plenty of Restaurants and shopping

review.title: Good location & good price
review.reviewText: I liked most of the hotel staff as they were very helpful.  I liked that we were close to Union Square, although you can use the Muni to anywhere in the city.  I didn't like how the staff cleaned my room.  The room we got was very small and cramped.  Elevator was old and would make weird sounds and movements.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is very close by if you like shopping.

review.title: Hotel Stay
review.reviewText:
This is a very old hotel but my stay was better than I thought it would be since I was not able to get a room anywhere in the Union Square area.

Location is good.  Accommodations are fair.  I felt the cleaning staff did a good job.

review.title: Cheap and cheerful
review.reviewText: didn't want to spend too much so this was a good choice in SF. Room and bathroom were nice and clean, had a safe, to and fridge in the room. A tad on the small side but perfectly fine. The hotel itself could do with been renovated. The breakfast is not continental as stated. That seems to be a problem amongst majority of US hotels. They don't understand what a continental breakfast is. My breakfast was basically sugar. On offer was porridge, naff waffles, maple syrup, two different types of danish, bananas, hot chocolate, Apple juice, orange juice, tea and coffee. If you're a healthy eater, this isn't the greatest. Good location, close to union square and a bike hire and car hire place. Just don't head down the road towards Market from the hotel, it's a rough neighbourhood. Other than that the location is fine, the Hilton is only a couple of building a way so it's not bad at all.

review.title: Nice, clean and comfortable hotel. Near downtown.
review.reviewText: We were satisfied with the service. Our room and bed made us comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable and very condusive to sleep.
review.locationRemarks: Near downtown for shopping and eating.

review.title: Good location, decent accomodations
review.reviewText: The hotel was one of the cheaper options that included WIFI and complementary breakfast. Good proximity to restaurants and shopping, however it also seemed to be on the border of good/slummy area.
review.positiveRemarks: WIFI included, as well as proximity to cable car, BART, rental cars, and restaurants/shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel room was clean and sufficient, but it was a little bit musty smelling.
review.locationRemarks: Proximity to cable car, BART, rental cars, and restaurants/shopping.

review.title: Noise noise noise
review.reviewText: Club downstairs, heavy music until 2am.  Veeeeerrrrrryyyyyyy loud!  Don't live here if you want to sleep.

review.title: Common Areas Not Clean but Room ok
review.reviewText: The lobby smelled like Chinese food because the staff was eating while at the front desk. The hall way on the 6th floor smelled like a laundry room dryer vent. Everything else was fine for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff should not eat smelly food in the lobby while on duty.
review.locationRemarks: Near a big mall on Market.

review.title: Great for shoppers and diners.
review.reviewText: We stayed here when the baseball playoffs forced an additional game before wrapping up the Divisional championship, so it was a last minute reservation on a Tuesday night. We're so glad we found this place! We've stayed in several hotels in this area with advance reservations so we were worried about finding a place at the last minute. Now, I think we'll always stay here. We liked the location for shopping and dining. It is a small, older place but with refreshing updates. The lobby is tiny but who stays in the lobby? The desk clerk was courteous and helpful. We chose the stairs to our 4th floor room because they were old and creaky, which, for us added charm. The elevator was efficient, as well. The room was small but clean, fresh, and delightful. The bathroom was large! And the windows overlooking the street were sparkling! No city soot!
review.positiveRemarks: It's updated but still old and charming. It was safe and clean. Staff was wonderful. Free breakfast was nicely set out.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping at Union Square, numerous restaurants, theater district, cable car.

review.title: Close to downtown
review.reviewText: Good location, poor breakfast. Room was really clean. I stayed in 5 star Marriott right after and it must say that the housekeeping in Super Union was doing better job.
review.positiveRemarks: the motel is close to downtown. The location is very convenient. Housekeeping is doing great job.
review.negativeRemarks: It is important to remember that you get what you pay for. However, the breakfast is really poor.

review.title: Typical 2 star hotel
review.reviewText: Being a 2 star it is used by several different types of people including the odd noisy selfish type
review.locationRemarks: Central to city which includes begging and homeless area near by

review.title: Good location for city & wharf
review.reviewText: First impressions of foyer & entrance & lift were disappointing as rather run down. Room & bathroom clean, comfortable & recently doneq up so overall experience positive.
review.locationRemarks: City & wharf area, lots to do & see.

review.reviewText: Rooms were alright for sleeping and getting ready. We had a small problem with the first room they gave us but they immediately took care of the problem and gave us a new room. Besides that no problems. There is a little convenient store right next to the hotel which is perfect for a quick drink or snack.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union Square and one of the Open Tour Bus stops. You are just 2 streets away from a ton of places to shop and eat.

review.title: Horrible!
review.reviewText:
So...first .. You need to read about "TENDERLOIN" area! It will tell you a lot by it self! Super 8 is in that area. We stayed there for 2 nights. A/C was not fonctioning despite a request at the front desk and a promise to fix it. We were forced to sleep in the same room the 2nd night!!! We slept with windows wide open while people were yelling outside and cops were chasing some.
Second... Front desk people were more interested by there computers in the corner of the room than actual customers! The room was also small... We had some dirty pillow cases on the two beds of the rooms...!!!  DEFINITELY would pay few bucks more to be in a safe and basic room because that was one of the worst rooms/hotel we've been in!! 
On a good note, try the TAYLOR ST CAFE juste around that corner....
review.locationRemarks: Tenderloin!!!! Not the best!!!

review.title: Nice hotel, reasonably priced, close to Union Sq.
review.reviewText: I was hesitant to book my hotel here since Super8 is a hotel chain. At first I wanted to try the local charm of the city and try the boutique hotels but they were just way above my budget. I took a chance at Super8 but was very impressed with their service and quality of room. Walking distance from Union Square and rooms with AC. I appreciate the valet service with IN and OUT privileges. Just make sure to request for your car 20 minutes before you decide to leave.

review.title: Great hotel in central area
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great area, only a couple of blocks from Union Square. The room was small but clean and the hotel staff were really helpful.

review.title: Ok if you are on a budget
review.reviewText: Got stuck in the sketchy elevator, staff not very helpful. Very old,not updated, but an ok stay to save money.
review.locationRemarks: Ok location, close to transit, 10 minute walk to F-train to fisherman's wharf

review.title: Location makes it worth it
review.reviewText: Stayed over memorial day weekend. Homeless folks hang outside the building but the location towards union square is great and walking distance to the water. Room very cramped (couldn't walk between the bed and tv) but beds were clean and comfortable. There are no real amenities here except for the free breakfast which we didn't go to. Security was a bit lax for the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Price was right, room was comfortable but VERY small. Excellent area for food choices
review.negativeRemarks: Staff was efficient but very unfriendly. Parking rates were exorbitant.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants and fast food choices!!

review.title: barebones adequate
review.reviewText: Room was tiny but clean. Water was nice and hot. Lightbulb that was burnt out wasn't replaced even after notifying front desk. Had to prop open sink drain with cardboard to allow water to drain. Breakfast could barely be called breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean. Good hot water. Central location.
review.negativeRemarks: Sink drain, replace light bulb, better breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Good central location

review.title: Homeless Haven
review.reviewText: Its an old run down building with homeless people and drug addicts lurking around the entrance and surrounding streets 24/7.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the Hilton, Geary and Market St.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The room was clean and tidy but there were some problems - there was no blackout curtain on one of the windows, one of the lights in the bathroom kept flickering on and off, the shower handle was loose and our phone did not work. Told the manager who said they would be fixed but they weren't during our 4 night stay. Did not find the reception staff particularly helpful. Were not told about the $25 per night charge for parking at time of booking. Breakfast was basic but plenty of it-not much in the way of seating though! Surprised at the people staying there-a real range from business people, older holidaymakers and young people from all over the world. Location was a bit dicey a lot of down and outs but the Hilton was in the next block so can't be all bad. Prefer to spend my holiday money on seeing and doing things than plush hotels- as long as it is clean and tidy.
review.positiveRemarks: Was basic,clean and tidy and good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Repairing things and more welcoming staff.
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq, Chinatown,Market Street. Area a bit scary with all the down and outs but they don't really bother you

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: Very poor hotel, very well located, honest breakfast.

review.title: Reasonably priced, close to everything
review.reviewText: Reasonably priced hotel in a great location. Staff are extremely helpful.

review.title: Nice Hotel, close to everything on SFCity
review.reviewText: The Hotel is located very close to Union Square, but also near to Tenderloin ( it's a disgusting area at SF)

review.title: Good value.
review.reviewText: It was comfortable. Water pressure in the shower was great. An improvement to most old hotels we have stayed in. Refrigerator in room is always a plus and complimentary breakfast was fine. We would definitely book again
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, close to cable car and all my Union Square favorites.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from running water in toilet. Shower valve needs tightening to completely shut off; a CA. must to conserve water.

review.title: Fair room for the price
review.reviewText: It was certainly not the nicest hotel I've ever stayed at, but considering the price, it met my expectations. The room was clean. There were no offensive odors, noises, or insects. It had the normal array of room amenities, plus there was an in-room fridge. I felt safe in the hotel. Next time I'm in the area, I would stay there again.

review.title: Location is the best
review.reviewText: Location was good. Close to shopping, cable car, market street. Every place is walkable and good number of restaurants. Room was small and the place is so narrow

review.title: Cheap n center location
review.reviewText: Cheap n center location. Valet parking in n out took 30min but worth it. Perfect howl for people on a budget.

review.title: Hole in the wall lol
review.reviewText: Over all it was a good stay, the room was great. The location of the hotel was a bit weird however it was located in San Francisco near a lot of party hangouts and it was extremely loud outside.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: This is the second time that we've stayed here. The hotel is an old building and apparently used to be a Holiday Inn because you can still see signs of it if you look. I think that they've done pretty good making the rooms as good as they are. It's comfortable and we like that the bathroom was nice a big. The upside is that it's location is nice and close to the Powell/Market area and also Union Square is just a couple of blocks away also. There are a nice selection of very good places to eat.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade the TV service. It went out a couple of times and was unreliable. Get rid of Dish TV and go with Direct TV.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and the Powell Street Cable Car turnaround. Bart is close also.

review.title: Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Staff was uncooperative and hotel stunk, Very old building
review.locationRemarks: good food and shopping

review.title: nice hotel with this price
review.reviewText:
compare with other hotels under this price, I'd like to say this one is quite clean with a large bathroom. and the free breakfast and wireless internet is good for me.
the only problem is my T-mobile cellphone always with poor signal in my room.

review.title: Not so Good
review.reviewText: The room was very small. Everything is very old. Centerly

review.title: Get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Nothing flashy about this hotel but it served its purpose. The location was good and close to transit and taxis. Complimentary breakfast wasn't anything special but it was nice that there was something provided. The elevator was a little sketchy but the staff were friendly and helpful. If you plan to spend a few days in San Fran, it's not a bad option.

review.title: i always choose super 8 in san francisco
review.reviewText:
5 months ago, i stayed in super 8 in san francisco union square.
here was nice location.nice staff.
every san francisco hotels are so expensive. i think here was also not cheap.
but it's cheaper than other hotels.
so i choose again this trip.
i arrived in san francisco early. so i worried about where i go.
i just went to the this hotel because i wanted someone keep my bag.
but super 8, checked room and than i could check in early!
so amazing.
location also very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: union square and so on. you can go everywhere easily!!!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights.
Good location about 3 blocks far from market st n Powell st.
Close to Powell Bart train 3 blocks
If you are thinking take the Bart train to SFO airport.
Close to restaurants, stores, downtown sfo.
Free breakfast.

review.title: Excellent location in Union Square
review.reviewText: No issues with check in, room was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and helped recommending places to visit... the complimentary breakfast was good, but we needed to buy a couple of sandwiches in wall greens to complement it, overall the experience was good.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, room was clean, comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: include something else in the breakfast, something salty like a sandwich
review.locationRemarks: 3 blocks from cable cars and BART station very convenient!!!!

review.title: Pleasant surprise and great value
review.reviewText: For under $100 near Union Square, my expectations were pretty low. I was pleasantly surprised once I got inside the hotel. Spartan lobby but clean and efficient. The room was super clean, had a comfortable bed, a large bathroon, free WiFi, satelite flatscreen HD TV and a fridge. I was shocked how quiet the room was. Complimentary continental breakfast was better than expected. Overall It was the best value possible.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and well appointed room. Super quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator is old. Lobby has no atmosphere. The block of O'Farrell is a bit sketchy and has that Tenderloin feel with homeless people around.
review.locationRemarks: Proximity to Union Square, Chinatown and all that is walkable in downtown SF.

review.title: Central, clean
review.reviewText: The hotel is central, at the edge to Tenderloin. Expect lots of people and traffic on the street but that's to be expected for a central place. Rooms are small but the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean - nothing to complain. The breakfast is basic - if that doesn't suit you there are plenty of full-american breakfast places nearby. Staff was nice but at NYE a bit overwhelmed and hectic. Overall if you don't plan to stay long hours in your room but sleep or drop your shopping bags I would recommend it.

review.title: Super close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Although there are other hotels nearby, this one got my budget. Not only that, but the stay was very nice. I reserved a suite; so for slightly cheaper than other places, you get more here. I like the fact that breakfast is included. The walk to Union Square is really close by as well! (I forgot to take pictures)

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText:
Location is quite good however it is not a 100 usd per night worth
Value for money is not there
However if you would like to stay close to the union square and enjoy downtown and other hotels are totally booked or asking for high price you can go for this
Internet speed was slow and rooms are very very small with no almirah
Hotel staff does not know anything about nearby.

review.title: don't stay here
review.reviewText: This was a terrible experience. I will never stay here in the future. In fact, I checked out after coming back in the evening to find out the window locks were inoperable. My safety was in question and I left the hotel that evening.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. The hotel should be closed.

review.title: Good location, that's it
review.reviewText: The hotel didn't seem like a bad deal because of the location. I was attending a conference at the Hilton which is half a block down. Other than that I'd have stayed somewhere else. The room was clean but the towels and sheets had holes. The internet was gone for 3 out of 7 days I was there. The staff said there wasn't anything they could do since they had just installed new routers and they should be working fine. The elevator door was painted with an old rotten paint and the smell for the last 4 days was unbearable. Breakfast was ok: bread, cereal, pastry and apples. The room keys kept not working so we had to go down again to have them reprogrammed. In all, a hotel this quality should be way under $100/night so I feel I overpaid.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and most front desk staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No holes in towels and sheets, get the internet to work.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, Market Street and the Ferry Building. Easy transportation around. Long walks to fisherman's wharf, China Town, Civic Center.

review.reviewText:
staff were helpful
rooms clean
different kind of breakfast choices
near to buses
review.positiveRemarks: friendliness of people working there clean rooms
review.locationRemarks: no problem with location used buses to get around san fran

review.title: Nice and clean hotel
review.reviewText:
The location is perfect, just walking distance to Union square. The room is very clean although it's a bit small. Bed is comfortable but it's a bit small for couple. The bathroom is very new and clean, I think it's just been refurnished as other said. The only thing annoyed me a bit is during the weekend, it was not quiet enough due to parties outside the window I think.
Overall, it's a good hotel according to the price and location.

review.positiveRemarks: hotel staff is really helpful, the cleaniness is really good

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Good breakfast. Slow internet. Staff was mostly nice. Hole in the wall. No screen on the windows. Rooms are small

review.title: Nice close to down town
review.reviewText: disappointing, dirty sheets, no lobby. it is a motel not a hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Fantistic

review.title: Was bad expirince
review.reviewText:
Very small room. Not good bath
Very noisy

Elevators are in bad shape

Breakfast is very poor.

review.title: Good location for Downtown and Moscone centre.
review.reviewText: Same price as other mid-rate hotels in the area, but breakfast (albeit very basic self service) was included, which made it the most competitively priced!

review.title: Close to public transit and Union Square
review.reviewText:
Overall good hotel if you're not planning on spending much time in the room.
The room was very small (the bathroom was probably the same size as the room, so that's where we had to store our luggage)
Location was good as it was close to Union Square and public transit but there were some homeless problems if you walked further on down the block.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping and food at Union Square. Close to transit (subway from airport and Trolley to Pier 39)

review.title: Good and convenient
review.reviewText: One minute to union square, lots of restaurants around.Room is a bit small.

review.title: Good place to put your bags and get some sleep
review.reviewText: It's small, a bit run down, but for the price and location, I'd definitely recommend it.

review.title: Nice for the price
review.reviewText: its just 30 seconds from the Hilton and it is safe but don't go further up passed the hotel as it turns into the twilight zone with homeless people everywhere ,but on saying the room was really nice large bathroom bigger than the bedroom the free breakfast was nice with cereal fresh fruit coffee so stuff your pockets and use it for lunch and the staff where great nice and friendly but its a bit noisy but you are right in the thick of union square so yes go and stay there you get what you pay for.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice clean rooms large tv and great bathroom unlike large chain hotels its free wi fi!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: maybe a paint job and new carpet and more security on the front door
review.locationRemarks: Everything 2 streets up is union square you can book shows at half tics ,shopping catch hop on buses and a must is the Victorian house walking tour!!

review.title: Nice for resting
review.reviewText: Nice for resting when on a business trip. Lobby needs some work or I should say it needs a lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: New lobby. Fix the elevator sounds.
review.locationRemarks: Close to many restaurants and public transportation.

review.title: Small but comfortable
review.reviewText:
Got more than I expected for what I booked, kind of.

I knew the rooms were small, so I wasnt shocked that they are SMALL! Like 10x11 with a 3x5 bathroom small.

The bed and pillows were surprisingly comfortable.

The staff was pretty minimal, so interactions with them were infrequent, but pleasant when they existed.

Pretty good TV selection. Hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin, so a bit sketchy, but nothing to worry about.

Overall for what you pay and where you are I think it's good value.

review.title: Very close to union square
review.reviewText: Every thing was ok. Except with the breakfast room was too small and the tables and chairs were too awkward i.e chairs too tall for the tables. Staff was very helpful. T was a very nice vaction in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Our rooms were separated one side beds the other side living rooms. Both were clean except for a weird smell but not too bad. It was close to union sq
review.negativeRemarks: Get better tables chairs bigger room for breakfast room.

review.title: Very old fashioned but fun
review.reviewText: I wish I had known that I wasn't charged for parking when I booked the hotel. we had to Pay when we got there and the parking was a little worrying I didn't even know where it was and so I was afraid it would be broken into since it wasn't that great of a neighborhood but it ended up being fine
review.positiveRemarks: Very old fashioned feeling, very friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, size of rooms, shower rod broken
review.locationRemarks: Close to union park, att park. Shopping.

review.title: The Smell Of Urine
review.reviewText: The smell of the entire hotel smelled terrible. Carpet of room had large black spots all over it. This place was just disgusting. I could tell they were trying to keep the room acceptable but just didn't have the resources to do things right.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, but no price could compensate for how cruddy this place is.
review.negativeRemarks: Gut the place and start over.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Small room a little noisy at night due to the street noise below. Otherwise OK

review.title: close to Hilton
review.reviewText: The room was clean and the staff was cheerful and helpful. The hotel was very close to the conference I was attending at the Hilton. The room was very small. I've seen small hotel rooms done beautifully in NYC, and this wasn't it. It was basically regular-sized hotel furniture and a huge television crammed into a very small room with a double bed. The room was also a bit dingy with chipping paint, a cracked switch on the air-conditioner and a drain plug that didn't work in the bathroom. The room was clean though, good for the price and very close to where I wanted to be.

review.title: Small but comfortable
review.reviewText: We were surprised at the room, we didn't expect a lot however the room was in excellent condition and very clean. We were located on the second floor and the noise from the restaurant below was a little off putting late in the evening. The staff was friendly and helpful from the front desk to the cleaning staff. We would stay there again, we had heard the neighborhood was iffy but we had no more problems than in any other part of the city during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to downtown and near all the Muni stops we needed, very friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast room was very small and the table chair arrangement could be made to be more comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Good central location, just a few blocks from Market street, lots of shopping very near and easy connections to get down to the wharf area.

review.title: Decent price
review.reviewText:
An older hotel with a decent price. Breakfast is included but the breakfast room is a bit tight. WIFI is also included but coverage is spotty and variable. We got better coverage from the next door hostel wifi. Bathrooms have been renovated and are in excellent shape!

Good bus service close by, lots of restaurant around. Close to union square, 2 cable car lines and a few metro stations.
review.locationRemarks: Good spot, but just borderline sketchy part of town

review.title: Cheap alternative for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good experience as far as Super 8 goes. Good price for downtown San Francisco. Looks like they recently did a few minor updates to the bathrooms as well.

review.title: great value!
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff. Easy walking distance to Union Square, BART station, trolley lines.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Not the cleanest (had to ask for fresh bed linen), but overall OK for such a good location.

review.title: Good value hotel in desirable area
review.reviewText:
This was very good value for money. The hotel may not have the most up to date decor, but it was very clean, with very friendly, helpful and polite staff. The room was very comfortable with nicely equipped ensuite bathroom. The breakfast was continental with as much juice and tea and coffee as you would like. There were also tea and coffee facilities in the room along with a fridge. The first room I was allocated did not have windows that locked. When I explained this I was moved to a really nice room with locking windows.

I would recommend this hotel as good value for money in a desirably area. The hotel is within easy walking distance of cable cars, China Town, theatres, Market Street and trolley busses to Fisherman's Wharf and Piers, and other tourist attractions.There are local eateries and cafes near the hotel to suite a variety of tastes and budgets. If you are interested there is excellent shopping very near the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the comfort, the cleanliness, the facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: The first room I was given did not have locking windows.
review.locationRemarks: Highly desirable a few doors away from The Hilton.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Just ok, got what I expected for the price. The rooms and beds were rather small not much room to move around. However the bathroom sizing was adequate. Breakfast was good enough. The good thing is the central location of the hotel easy access to everything. Easy walking distance to union square and moscone center.
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: a central location but parking is a mess
review.reviewText: it is an old hotel that is being renovated, ok for the price

review.title: Good buissness trip hotel
review.reviewText: It's old, small and it shows, but the staff is nice enough and they keep things as clean as one could hope for in such an old building. I've also never encountered any pests.
review.positiveRemarks: clean, decent breakfast, close to unity square
review.locationRemarks: On the edge between nice and not so nice parts of town, but that describes most of that area

review.title: A relatively nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to Union Square. The staff is nice.
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square

review.title: good location good price.no real ammenities
review.reviewText: basic room with queen bed. front staff excellent. bathroom real clean.if your looking for bed clean bathroom for good price in central san francisco would meet ur needs
review.locationRemarks: union square are of san francisco

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Helpful staff, made a big difference in a new city
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: I would love to go back to San Francisco it was amazing really fantastic the food the shopping everything! This hotel was in a great location for us close to everything we needed.

review.title: good value and clean place
review.reviewText:
clean, friendly staff, the price was very good....

the neighborhood might be a bit sketchy for those who aren't aware that the tenderloin area is generally a place to keep ones eyes open.

review.title: Good on a budget.
review.reviewText: A great price, close to union square and the room was just fine. I was lucky to get an inside room so the street noise didn't bother me at all. The bed was comfortable and the shower was nice and hot with good pressure. In a rough neighborhood but don't let that scare you off!
review.negativeRemarks: dirty carpet, noisy if you have a street room
review.locationRemarks: great central location

review.title: San Fran Dump
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a not particularly easy on any of the senses. It was old and run down, it smelt funny and wasn't in the best part of the neighbourhood (downtown near the outskirts of the tenderloin).
There were stains on some of the sheets, the carpet was old and sticky. The toilet got blocked and rather than come up to help the hotel staff told us they would give us a plunger to clean it ourselves (fair point some might say but when you book a hotel you also pay for service).
I never felt clean in that room and we always kept the "privacy do not enter" sign up when we left for the day as it was hard to trust the staff.
The free breakfast consisted of a few basic cereals and some fatty pastries in plastic wrappers. Not a great way to start the day, better off going to Lori's Diner. Amazing food there!
The elevator was really sketchy too and felt like it was going to break and plummet at any second.

Overall Ok for very basic budget travel but best avoided if you value cleanliness and security for your possessions
review.positiveRemarks: It was a roof over our heads
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently close to union square but at a price. The tenderloin is not that far away. Lots of rubbish on the streets and hagglers

review.title: No Frills Stay Near Union Square
review.reviewText: Conventient location to Union Square, and the price is affordable. Staff was very polite and considerate. This is a no frills stay, fine for overnight accommodations if you plan to spend limited time in the room. Overall, the hotel can use a renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Across the block from Hilton, three blocks from Union Square. Lots of homeless around, but that is the case all over this area.

review.title: Great rate and location, but small room
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient to Union Square. If you are attending a convention at the Hilton, it is right across the side street. The bedding is very comfortable, including the mattress, sheets and pillows, which is very important to me. The room is very small since it is an old building, but the bathroom is very large. I was in a single double bed room. It had a desk and dresser, with a 32 inch flat screen tv, as well as a closet and coffee maker. I would stay there again for the price. The lobby and entrance are nothing special, but who cares when you get a good rate!
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Definitely not for families
review.reviewText: Don't go out at night. Or get back to the hotel before 11:00. When returning to the hotel on foot I was offered all the cocaine I could want. Also, you have to dodge an agility course of pimps, prostitutes and bums to get back to the hotel/converted apartment building.

review.title: Pleasant stay at Super 8
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful which made the stay pleasant. The room was tiny but clean. The hotel location is right on the outskirts of the Tenderloin district. Basically, you get good value for the cost, which was reasonable for Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: If you stay on the Powell Street side of the hotel it's pretty safe. The East side of the hotel is pretty sketchy.

review.title: Awful!!!!
review.reviewText: When I called Expedia the women on the phone read me some reviews that weren't bad at all she said it was a 3 out 5 stars.so I thought that would be fine! I've stayed at many 3 out of 5 star hotels before . This motel was a nightmare from a hair in the shower to dirty walls/floors!! You could hear every noise . There was lots of yelling ,screaming ,homeless people around the motel all night long!!It was very scary !!!! I could not sleep we packed up early and left almost thought bout leaving at 1am but to scared to go get the car!! Also,when I booked I told the expedia phone receptionist I wanted a non-smoking room which they had in their computer that I wanted smoking which was incorrect. So they moved me to a non-smoking but u could smell cigarette smoke when u turned on the ac!!! I'm not happy with Expedia or the motel!!
review.locationRemarks: Horriable neighborhood very dangerous area in sf!!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Noisy at night because of the pub down stair. But is not the hotel's problem. Great location and the room is bit small,what can you say this is San Francisco.

review.title: 8(not super)
review.reviewText:
we had a bathroom between a lounge and a bedroom ,in the bedroom were 2 double beds for 3 adults.The bedroom was to small for 2 double beds,it would have been better with a bed in each room.
I thought it was more like a backpackers hotel than a hotel for seniors or families with young children.
review.positiveRemarks: the comfort of the beds and breakfast
review.locationRemarks: location was excellent right near union square

review.title: Only for business travel on the cheap
review.reviewText:
Only for business travelers on the cheap.

No hot water in the evening.

The elevator was very questionable.

Good location, but for pure function only. No kids, no spouses.

review.title: Very Near with Union Square
review.reviewText: Good Room and great position very near with Union Square

review.title: Do NOT go to this hotel!
review.reviewText:
There are three reasons for me do not recommend this hotel:
1. Not respect to customer: I reserved a non-smoking room, but they give me a smoked one!!! During my four days living there, they simply told me there is NO non-smoking room available for me!
2. Bad sleeping condition: There is a dancing club right close to the hotel. At night, especially at Weekends, the whole hotel rocks! The floor literally shakes and it is IMPOSSIBLE for you to sleep!
3. No responsible for the noise at night: I called the customer service at 11:00 PM in the hotel, and no one pick up the phone at! I don't know where they can find a place to sleep in the hotel as well.

I concede that there are also some Good sides:
1. Some of the person working there are very nice.
2. Price is reasonable, and location is very convenient.

However, the three bad-side really overwhelm the good-side, so that is the reason I give it one level in the five level scale.

review.title: Great Location, for a good price.
review.reviewText: The price and location are pretty good. I will stay there again. The only drawback is it's a little close to "The Tenderloin". 1/2 block in the wrong direction, and you are in a bad area.

review.title: Happy to return
review.reviewText: Free continental breakfast was great, as was the location and staff. No noise issues for me.

review.title: Gets the job done
review.reviewText: Perfectly functional. Clean and well-equipped rooms. The whole place is a little bit run-down, and in a stretch of O'Farrell street that has a little more 'character'. But it's totally adequate.

review.title: A Simple Stay
review.reviewText: Great budget hotel in a good location. Nothing fancy. Typical Super 8 motel. Our room was cleaner than expected.
review.positiveRemarks: Valet parking for $19 per night with in and out privileges. That can't be beat in San Francisco!!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: this hotel is really cheep for its location. I suggust you park at EZ parking two blocks down on Jones. Its only $17 overnight with free in's and out's

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Excellent value for money. 5 mins from centre of everything. Room was cleaned & fresh towels every day during our 6 night stay. New tv in room day we arrived, coffee machine (& coffee), free wi-fi and plentiful fresh continental self-serve breakfast available every morning. Rooms could do with a paint but fittings all modern and a room safe would have been useful. Stayed on 4th floor with street view and could open the windows which we liked, no problem with street noise and blackout curtains were good. Advised not to go 'left' outside of hotel as there would be nothing we needed in that direction. Opposite was The Serrano hotel and next block The Hilton and we had no problems outside the hotel. Caught the BART train back to the airport which was very easy and much cheaper than a taxi or shuttle!
review.locationRemarks: Good central location, they say you are in the 'Tenderloin' which is not a nice area but it is on the outskirts and next to 2 large hotels!

review.title: A no frills hotel that works well
review.reviewText: Well - this hotel is just OK. It's in a GREAT location. The rooms were outdated...the hotel is old...the breakfast room is rather depressing. But the rooms were clean, the staff friendly and it worked just fine for our purposes.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: Cheap hotel in a convenient area
review.reviewText:
The hotel is OK. It is a super 8 so don't expect luxury. Breakfast was the standard in all super 8 hotels: cereals, bagels, fruit, orange juice, milk, etc.
Beds were comfortable, the bathroom worked ok. Maybe the only complain is the furniture was a bit too old, the carpet wasn't great and the room didn't have too much light...
In any case is exactly what I expected of a Super 8 and the price I paid.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough light in the room
review.locationRemarks: Becareful of the streets next to the hotel, they can be really scary during the night

review.title: IT'S NOT THAT BAD!!! I'd stay again.
review.reviewText: I'm not sure if I walked into this already expecting the worst, reading all the terrible reviews. I was doing this trip cheap and quick. IT WASN'T THAT BAD. I've stayed everywhere. from 2 star to 5, and when I'm paying this little for a room, I'm not expecting the Waldorf. It was clean, a bit noisy in the morning but all hotels are like that. The staff was nice, nothing outstanding but knowledgeable about the area and made suggestions on places to go. One of these 'scary people' on the street said we looked hungry and gave us 3 places on that block the he's recommend to anyone. You have to wait about ten minutes for your car but, everything is in walking distance, including public transport, we called for the car one day and realized we could haver taken the BART. It's an old building, room was small-ish, but it was quaint. Maybe we were expecting the worst. And for the area... It's downtown in a major city, THEY'RE ALL LIKE THIS. If you travel a lot, it's no different than LA, SD, Rome, Madrid, it's a little dirty, it's a little noisy, that's part of the experience. I'd go back if I were on a small budget again. With the money we saved we spared no expense on food, drinks and excursions.

review.title: Super zero
review.reviewText: Positives: Good location, free wi-fi ... that's all. Negatives: Everything else ...

review.title: Perfect for city trip, price is the big plus!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is perfect for a city trip for a couple of days because of the price.
The room was small, but clean. Unfortunaley, you can hear everything as the walls are really wafer-thin. If you don't want luxus and just need a good place to sleep, this is perfect.
The hotel is situated close to Union Square next to Hilton Hotel. Area is ok, but you shouldn't walk into the wrong direction to the low-income-area!
Staff was friendly and helped with everything.

I can absolutely recommend it for the purpose of just having a nice place to sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Complementary breakfst, friendly staff, perfect location
review.locationRemarks: close to union square, next to hilton hotel

review.title: It's ok.
review.reviewText: It's a room. It's cheap. It's close to Union Square. That's about it. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay and do not care much about the quality, this hotel is for you.

review.title: Convenience and the good price
review.reviewText: This hotel is next to Hilton which means the location takes the same benefit as Hilton hotel. There is nothing to complain even including free WIFi and breakfast at this price.

review.title: Not a top class hotel but good for the price
review.reviewText:
Close to union square and other attractions.Close enough to walk with light luggage to amtrak bus.
Shopping and cable cars only a short distance away.

review.title: Bedbugs!!!!!!
review.reviewText:
Bedbugs - don't bother moving rooms because they are in 2 rooms for sure. The worst is you could potentially take them home with you in your clothes and luggage.

So even though staff was friendly, breakfast was excellent and location was ok from a safety perspective, the bedbugs made it awful.

There is a bed bug registry so would strongly suggest checking all hotels against this prior to booking.

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: ok - convenient

review.title: good place for families and international travelers
review.reviewText: My mother, my two girls, and I arrived in the middle of a downpour. The hotel staff was wonderful, got our car parked, our room was ready, and they were attentive throughout our stay. The hotel is superbly located, near the Hilton and several pricier hotels. The only issues we had were the rickety elevator which seemed to be on the verge of collapse (my two girls took the stairs, they were afraid) and that the ice machine was not working, so I had to go to the convenience store in the rain (one of my daughters has a stress fracture that needed icing). but the breakfast was good, the price great, and overall, we will stay there again.
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square, Japan Town, UCSF

interesting sights, in the case of Japan Town and UCSF, relatively safe and quiet, near the wonderful museums and golden gate park, in the case of Union Square, near shopping, MOMA, cable cars, and lots of things for kids, including ice skating and the metrodome.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Hotel is conveniently located and clean. Free wireless.

No telephone in the room because it was broken. With today's cell phone use no problem in general, for wake up call set up, though, annoying since not possible.

Over the three days I stayed there and several requests to several staff mebers they were not able to provide me with an iron board.

review.title: Affordable, great location
review.reviewText: This is not a fancy hotel, by any means, but our room was clean, quiet and secure. It was small and somewhat outdated, but we were only there to sleep, so that was fine. The location in the Union Square area was terrific. We were a couple of blocks from Market Street, so it was easy to catch the street car to Fisherman's Wharf and also close to great restaurants and stores. The hotel offered a free continental breakfast in a tiny room on the 6th floor, which consisted of cereal, bagels, packaged pastries, apples, bananas, juice and coffee. Overall, it was a great value and I would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Very much enjoyed Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Union Square and Golden Gate Park.

review.title: If you really don't mind.
review.reviewText:
Rolled into SFO late Sunday afternoon. First impressions upon arrival outside the hotel, is that there is no parking at any time. You have to have the hotel valet park the car somewhere in the vicinity at a parking garage. The entry into the hotel, first impressions again, rather drab and looking tired and run down. Staff (1) helpful in getting you registered and arranging the car parking etc. Shabby lift to 3rd floor, and on entry into the room, again was disappointing. Room faced inwards and had no natural light, unless you stuck your head out of the window and looked up. Bathroom as big as bedroom and had a "wet room".
Breakfast was of a continental type in a room up on the 6th floor.
Very central location (less than 1/2 mile to Union Square, cable car and shops etc.
So, if you really don't mind all that and you want a cheap, but central location, look no further. If you want a bit of luxury in the same locale......Dig deeper.
review.locationRemarks: This location was very central to most all of San Francisco

review.title: Run down flea bag hotel. Live bed bug on pillow which I presented to the front desk guy. Ick.
review.reviewText: This place is in desparate need a complete renovation. The floors are wood and have sagging areas, the elevator feels highly questionable. The woodwork has been painted over so many times it's pathetic. The rooms, like most SF establishments are tiny. I found a live bed bug on my pillow which I saved and showed to the front desk guy. He seemed genuinely concerned and moved me to another room. The carpet and quilted nylon comfortable had stains on it. The rooms were clean enough, but the condition of everything is ratty.
