I only stayed there because I refuse to spend $400-500 a night for a Hilton-equivalent. My advice? If you're booking a hotel in San Francisco, do it early... When the town is booked up the rates skyrocket....

review.title: too loud
review.reviewText: arrived after a long flight very tired. There was loud music all night. discovered the next morning that there is a bar right next to the hotel. bedsheets had burn marks from cigarette burns in them. breakfast was basic but ok. room was clean.

review.title: Save $ while right in the heart of shopping
review.reviewText: Nice Folks!

review.title: Super *
review.reviewText:
Served its purpose beautifully.

Thanks to the great staff!

review.title: Very disappointed in Super 8
review.reviewText:
I always thought with a chain hotel like Super 8 or Motel 6, you can't go wrong.

Where do I start.

First, to address a previous review, during our stay, the elevator was shut down for three days for repairs.

The hotel is several blocks from Union Square in The Tenderloin, one of the most dangerous neighborhoods in the country. It is one block over from the Hilton. The Hilton is in a good neighborhood, but once you pass Mason Street, it's as if you've entered a different world.

When we returned to the hotel each afternoon, the room had an offensive smell from the cleaning chemicals. I suppose they are trying their best.

Our room had no view, other than the two adjacent buildings a few feet across the alley.

The building is at least 100 years old. I don't fault the owner for trying to turn it into a character hotel, but in that neighborhood, there's really nothing you can do with it.

I don't fault the staff, either. During the elevator shut down, they did offer to transport luggage up and down the stairs.

review.title: Don't want to go back to this hotle ever again
review.reviewText:
You don't want to stay in that hotel, everything was of the lowest standard. The elevator was noisy, its floor was wet. The non smoking room had too much smoking odor. I had to change the room. The room was very small and not very clean. TV never worked. No one made the bad, bathroom was small.

In summary, the hotel is not worth staying. I have never stayed in such a horrible hotel.

review.title: I will stay there in every trip to SF
review.reviewText: This is a place where you can find what you need for a trip

review.title: Good mid-level experiece
review.reviewText: The hotel provided everything I need in a room away from home: hot shower, comfortable, clean bed.

review.title: Not a typical Super-8
review.reviewText: The hotel was rated 2 stars, I'd say it was 1 1/2. Friendly staff and great location, but this is a pretty old hotel and it shows it, with old furnishings, worn-out sheets, etc. It's not as nice as a typical Super 8.

review.title: Good place if you're on a budget
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an old building and everything feels a bit worn down. But they're at a great location, they offer free wifi (that works ok on the lower floors), and they're cheap. If you're looking for a clean and simple place and don't want to spend a whole lot you'll be fine here.

review.title: Good location,and very clean
review.reviewText: the Hotel is simple but confortable, had a good location and is very clean. The room is small but comfortable. And the price is very good. I recommend it.

review.title: ... allright
review.reviewText: Overall satisfaction: for the price and the location of the hotel, it is absolutely okay.

review.title: I don't like it.
review.reviewText: The hotel was not maintenance good. The last two nights of my stay there were bad. There was loud music coming from the restaurant which was beside the hotel. The music start at 11 PM and stop at 4 AM. The hotel couldn't do anything about it. The location of the hotel was OK, but one block of it was something like bad area with a lot homeless people. Specially at the night time if you have to walk in that direction is not very good idea. Nothing bad happened to me but I don't recommend anyone to walk there.

review.title: Never To Return
review.reviewText: While the room was larger than expected containing a small sitting room adjoining the bathroom, the door to the sitting room did not lock from the inside or the outside forcing us to keep the chain on the door at all times. The door that we exited from in the bedroom had to be pulled shut firmly before it locked. Also the hotel is right next door to a homeless shelter which prohibited smoking in from of their building which brought a large crowd to the front of the hotel. The night desk clerk was fast asleep the two nights we returned to the hotel after 1 a.m. and we had to wait at the door a few minutes until he was awake enough to buzz us in. Despite the fact that the room was prepaid for four days we checked out after two and moved to another hotel.

review.title: Not to bad for the price
review.reviewText: Room was very clean and location was was good.

review.title: Property Lost and few compensation
review.reviewText: We arrived in the morning. An Indian guy checked us in and gave us keys to room 415. The room is small and the carpet is not very clean. We went out for the Golden Gate.And when we came back, we found the light was on,and our bag is moved. Our GPS and 4 chargers and a very fine quality shaver, which we all put into a plastic bag were gone! The manager told us that in the system the Indian guy checked us to room 218, while he gave us the key to room 415. and that afternoon, he checked the other couple to room 415, who went into the room, and probably didn't lock the door properly. The manager who called Laura was helpful, and agreed to compensate us the next morning, after a couple of hours wait for the "owner". Our lost worth $920 totally, without counting the cable and flash-memory. However, she has the right up to only $750. So she issued a cheque of $750, and promise to send the rest ($170)to my friend's address in CA. Now we've come back home for more than 10 days, but my friend has not received the rest part of the money. Though we called and emailed several times, there was no person replying. How disappointed! and we'd never choose Super8 again. and maybe never go to San Fransico again!

review.title: Best affordable place in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convenient to walk to downtown and public transportation to get anywhere around the city. The rooms are very small, only a double bed for me and my daughter, but it was comfortable. We had our own bathroom with a shower. There was free wireless internet, as all Super 8s we've been to so far. There was also a nice Continental breakfast on the 6th floor. We called a van at the airport, which took us right to the hotel. There's a link on the hotel's internet site to call a 1-800 number for a slightly more inexpensive van. It's in Union Square, but maybe also Japantown, with great Japanese restaurant all around. I would definitely stay there again--clean, convenient, breakfast included.

review.title: Avoid this hotel, evitate questo albergo
review.reviewText: Don't stay in this hotel!! Non pernottate qua!! Nicht hier buchen!! The staff is rude (the blonde lady/manager is the worst!) The lcation seems great but it is very dangerous!! Internet connection is not working. The room is very dirty, sloppy and old!!! You will not sleep!! There is music till 2am! Lo staff e' ignorante e maleducato, la posizione e' pericolosissima, la connessione internet non funziona, la camera e' sporca (incluse lenzuola e asciugameni). La musica da dicoteca vi impedira' di dormire fino alle 2 del mattino. Non venite qui.

review.title: Tremendous location
review.reviewText: The touristic places for shopping and visiting are infinite. The team seems not belong to the area, but anyway, they are very kind. Staying at Union Square and close to the Theaters is a plus in the whole USA.

review.title: Convenient, but not really comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel locations is very convenient, but the facilities are not good at all. Breakfast could be alittle better, even considering that the rate is economic.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is two blocks from the Union Square. It has a liquor store , an internet cafe and a club walking distance. Felt safe walking during the night. GREAT for people who want just a place to crash.

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: Great location. Kind and helpful reception. Elevator needs air freshener. Rooms have coffee machine (complimentary coffee is bad, bring your own coffee/tea), styrofoam glasses (bring your own cup), hair drier, radio alarm clock, TV with remote. Towels and bedsheet were very clean and changed everyday. The worst thing is the fan heater which is very noisy (bring/buy earplugs if visiting in winter) Close the bathroom door to warmup the bedroom better. Hot water takes sometime to warm up. No cloth hangers or safe in the room. My room's fuse was tripping every 10mins (room 318), they couldn't repair it, but changed my room. Washing, ice and vending machines at 5th floor, breakfast (7-10am) at 6th floor. FREE breakfast is quite good: all you can eat, orange juice, coffee (good), tea, milk and cornflakes, jam, butter, cream spread cheese, bread and toaster, apple and banana, microwave. No sink, early hours less crowded. I suggest this hotel for budget travellers who don't mind the noisy heater.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The area was not comfortable to be in. The elevator was very small. Had one gentleman help and he had questions for a co-worker. The co-worker was rude and made us feel uncomfortable.

review.title: Not worth it
review.reviewText: Paper thin walls, very noisy at night.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: It is a good place for its price and location

review.title: Best value for money
review.reviewText: This motel was a big supprise! The WI-FI Internet for free. great (basic) breakfast. Good location!

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: The location is good. But the condition and maintenance of the room are not at all satisfactory. The people at the reception desk were OK. The name of the hotel has been changed to Alexanders Inn and we were looking for the name Super 8 Union Square. This was very misleading. It was noisy outside almost throught the night.

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText: Dirty, unfirendly, incompetent. Not at all recommended.

review.title: Clean, Functional Room to Overnight
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, basic, old-but well maintained, and unattractive. The location is convenient for downtown, the staff was nice and easy to work with.

review.title: I'm surprised in a good way
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised in that the room looks renovated with nice light fixtures, the bathroom has a new pedestal sink, the towels are clean, and everything looks clean. The hotel clerks who helped us check-in were very friendly. The hotel is also conveniently located a few blocks from Union Square the shopping area. I have no idea if all the room are renovated and refurbished, but I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Like feet?
review.reviewText: I've been to nicer for around the same price. The carpet was stained. There was a hole in the roof in the hall. The heater didn't work very well and the room smelt old and musky like feet. When I went down stairs to complain about an alarm clock that had been going of in the room next to mine for over an hour, in the middle of the night, nothing was done about it. I never saw the complementary breakfast.

review.title: GREAT FOR THE PRICE!
review.reviewText: Nice place right in the middle of everything. really happy with the price.

review.title: cleanliness a problem
review.reviewText: There was a conference on in San Fran when we arrived, so paid top dollar to stay in this hotel. Location was good, right near a major tram stop, which made it easy to get to everywhere else we wanted to go. Room cleanliness was a problem, our towels weren't clean, and our bedsheets had stains with I don't want to know what. Free breakfast was plain, but edible.

review.title: Still OK for just rest and sleep
review.reviewText: Room is too small

review.title: Bad staff
review.reviewText: Very bad staff no hairdrayer in the room

review.title: good hotel for a low budget
review.reviewText: The people at hotel were nice, they let me check in before the check in time. Room was good, management needs to check on housekeeping staff in order to have a cleaner bathroom. The elevator is old and needs maintanance. there was a variety of choices for continental breakfast for free! this was great! is a good hotel to save money, be comfortable and spend the rest of the budget shopping or in Sn.francisco attractions. ohh kids stay free.

review.title: Cheap and so close to Union Square
review.reviewText: If you are on a budget but want to just get away to the city and party all night, this is the hotel for you...no frills, rooms are very small but clean. Right on the border of the shady side and the Theatre side...walking distance to Union Square...you can't go wrong

review.title: Cheap, but just right!
review.reviewText: Right in the heart of downtown and as cheap for two people as staying at a hostel. For two friends on a budget, this was the place to go, and I'd definitely go back. It's a little small and there are absolutely no frills, but WHO CARES? You are in San Francisco? You won't be in your room anyway! The people were nice, we made some friends in the breakfast room, and everything is very clean.

review.title: Cheap, close to everything, very modest
review.reviewText: Cheap hotel, close to Market st and all major attractions. Definitely not the best area in the city. Room was clean, but needs some cosmetic remodelling - paint, doors,electric switch, etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast menu was unsatisfactory. Close location to a BART station (straight and cheap way to get to the SFO and OAK airports) is also important.

review.title: Poor old motel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very good located - and this is a very serious advantage The room is very small, bathroom is old and needs repare Breakfast is minimal.

review.title: Small and old but good price on a good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old with small rooms and not very well maintained but the location is great, just a 5 minute walk to Unionsquare. Don't expect anything from the breakfast, just cereal and old fruit but I wouldnt expect more for that price in the citycenter of San Francisco.

review.title: Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of town, this is the place to go. There are several parking garages nearby. If you go here, you need to get on the 4th floor or above, if not there is loud music played below the portion of the hotel that is extended over a night club. The music doesn't end until 2am, and there is no discount or refund by hotel management.

review.title: oakland
review.reviewText: nice... hotel great location

review.title: You get for wat you pay
review.reviewText: The room was small, it really can fit 2 people. Not too much fixture, there is a TV with cable connection. The bathroom was small. The water from the shower splash out to the floor, so remember to bring your own towel or ask for extra. The location of the hotel was not bad. Walkable distance to Union Square where you will find all the public transportation there. Very convenience.

review.title: Can't stay again.
review.reviewText: Nice, friendly and reliable service but some of the neighbours are bizarre and noisy, small and dark room, the hotel smells of some spices. Sorry to report negatively but San Francisco Hotels must be very expensive in general, for this amount you only get Alexander Inn I guess. Though very well located in downtown area, walking distance to Union Square etc.

review.title: Wow what a geto
review.reviewText: It was kind of scary, but suprisengy enophe room was very clean.

review.title: Alexander Inn Hotel and Suites
review.reviewText: This hotel is a thrifty place to stay and has the same feel. A standard room is large enough for the bed, tv and desk and offers about 1.5 fee of walking space. Upside ... Breakfast is good.

review.title: Very Basic
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because of location and price but was dissapointed with "couldnt care less attitued of the staff" if you are looking for something cheap this it the only good thing for us with this hotel was the breakfast. DONT get a room at the front [we sent email before we left asking for a quite room as we were flying 14 hours from Australia so guess were they put us right at the front the noise was terrible

review.title: No-frills, fairly priced
review.reviewText: This hotel was located near Union Square and many of the popular spots for visitors. The hotel room was very small, but clean with everything in good working order. The desk was responsive and gave me a wake-up call exactly when requested. A reasonable value at a very modest price.

review.title: Simple, but attend your expectations
review.reviewText: Cheap price,good breakfast, and clenliness. Good for business travelers.

review.title: Dirt, small space in the room and bugs
review.reviewText: When we arrived to this hotel it turned out that we have only one bed to sleep. Because my rommate was male as I am, we were not too happy. So, we divided the bed into two pieces (upper mattress and the lower one), rotated it and this way we survived. But after bed rotation we saw a lot of dirt and dust under the bed, it seems it was never cleaned there. The hotel condition is poor, the rooms are too small, the carpets have spots, and more importrant, my rommate got a lot of insects bites, probably bedbugs. Also, the noise from street is awful.

review.title: Don't Go
review.reviewText: Very small. Couldn't even open the dresser drawer very far. The bathroom door had a big hole it it by the knob and it would close. Very noisy. Band next door played loud music until 1 or 2 in the mornings. Had only 1 iron which clerk couldn't find and didn't really seem to care. Breakfast was the same every morning. Don't recommend! Will never stay again!!!

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and needs work. When we arrived on Saturday couldn't find a parking had to circle the block several times. The valet parking space was taken by someone in the bar next door. If staying the night and have to be up early don't get a room next to the street it was very loud until about 3 am.

review.title: Not impressed very small
review.reviewText: The rooms were very small. The hotel was not as close to China town or the Warf as I had thought it would be. The service poeple that worked there were very pleasant and helpful. Valet was $19 a day, not too bad of a price.

review.title: rundown
review.reviewText: the hotel itself was pretty rundown, however the staff is friendly. Also they have a good deal on parking and the complimentary breakfast is nice.

review.title: I won't do it again
review.reviewText: I took the room because of its low cost. I should not have been surprized by the shabby appearance of the hotel and my room.... but I was. It made me feel poorer than I am.

review.title: Close to Union Square + Budget
review.reviewText: Old carpet/furniture/etc - basic, but clean room. Breakfast included. Close to Union Square and cheap enough: good for students/travellers with low expectations

review.title: not what I expected
review.reviewText: It was a ok room. The furniturte and the carpet looked realy old. But the bed was comfy and the pillows too

review.title: Old hotel in not so good shape , decent location, good breakfast
review.reviewText: Needs a renovation immediately - very old and things are in a bad shape. The location being close to union square is a big plus alongwith the hot american breakfast every morning which isincluded in the room price. If staying in rooms facing the road - it is very noisy.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: ...but no luxury. The price is okay.

review.title: Centrally located..but poorly maintained
review.reviewText: This was one of the cheapest hotels in downtown San Francisco that I found. But it's cheap for a few reasons...the building is really old, the rooms are in poor condition, and the immediate neighbourhood is pretty bad. A good option if you are just looking for a place to crash after a night out in SF, but a bad option if you want the accomodation to be a part of your overall experience.

review.title: Great Hotel for Young People
review.reviewText: We got a suite for the four of us for roughly 20 per person in downtown San Francisco right in the middle of everything. Granted, the rooms werent the nicest, so I wouldnt recommend staying there on your honeymoon, but if you simply need a place to sleep and you need it for cheap, I dont think there is a better deal in the Bay area. We saved a lot more money in parking as well. Like if we got a room in one of the area suburbs we wouldve probably shelled out at least 15 more a day in parking and we would have to sit through bumper to bumper traffic, whereas at this hotel, you can just two blocks to Union Square and many other places. The rooms in the hotel, as you might be able to guess, being that it is in downtown and it is so affordable, are rather quite small. The hotel staff is very friendly as well.

review.title: Cheap downtown hotel - nothing special but worth it
review.reviewText: This is a nothing-special hotel that offers cheap rooms in an EXPENSIVE city. The room was small, the bed comfortable, and the shower had hot water. If you're looking for an amazing hotel experience, this isn't for you. If you're looking for a cheap, basic solution, this is definitely for you. Staff was friendly enough, valet parking (in and out options) for a decent price, and a moderately meager breakfast. I'd go back.

review.title: Very well located, good services
review.reviewText: This hotel is a little bit old but cozy. It's very located in the center of San Francisco, closed to transportation, shopping... There is an internet access so it's very practical. The breakfast is also included. I recommend it to anyone who would to stay for vacation in SFO.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: If you don't find better, this hotel should do.

review.title: Friendly Service
review.reviewText: This hotel may be old, yes...but they went out of their way to make me, the customer, happy. I did not indulge in the free breakfast, but my mother and my daughter did. I felt the room was clean. For the price, I would stay there again.

review.title: Don't go here
review.reviewText: Very old hotel, they are trying but it will take some time and lots of money.

review.title: Needs more work
review.reviewText: It's an old hotel,the owners are trying to restore.The place needs more work. Our suite was strange you had to walk through the bathroom to get from the living room to the bedroom. It was in the middle.

review.title: not a good hotel, but convenient from every aspects
review.reviewText: the service was fine, but the condition wasn't that good, especially the sound proof was terrible. you cant sleep until the bars below it close after midnight.

review.title: There are worse places
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the Tenderloin district of SF and was inexepensive. Therefore, you get exactly what you pay for. The good: The room was secure. While there, I didn't notice excessive noise. The bedding appeared clean and the bed was not uncomfortable. Bathroom was clean. The bad: Strong disinfectant smell. Cracked sink (couldn't hold water). Broken hair dryer. Everything was very worn and old. Safe was unusable since the lock had been drilled out. I would not recommend this hotel for couples or families. This hotel is good for single people who need a place to crash while in the center of SF.
